byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and JAMES KANTER

abstract: European finance ministers say they are near a deal to strengthen capital reserves for their troubled banks, first part of a package of measures meant to stem the worsening European debt crisis; also say holders of Greek bonds will have to take bigger losses than previously agreed upon.
snippet: On Sunday, leaders hope to announce the details of a bank recapitalization package and the outline of a plan to strengthen the overall euro rescue fund.
lead_paragraph: On Sunday, leaders hope to announce the details of a bank recapitalization package and the outline of a plan to strengthen the overall euro rescue fund.
